eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

Add the behavior to a Text object (BBText, Bitmap Text object) and choose the interval between characters.

* When the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
* You can change the speed of the text typing by changing the interval with events.
* Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
* You can also pause the typing and resume it after.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for texts ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension requires two actions to function correctly:
1) "Lock projectile to target" should be used once per projectile. 
2) "Move projectile towards target" should be run every frame.  This will move all projectiles that are locked to targets.

Parameters:
- Rotation Speed: How fast the projectile rotates. This is critical in determining how fast the projectile can turn corners.
- Initial Speed: Starting speed of the projectile
- Acceleration: How much speed is added over time
- Max Speed:  The max speed a projectile can travel (does not apply to physics object)
- Max Lifetime:  The number of seconds a projectile can exist after locking onto a target.  Once this time is reached the object is deleted.

Tips:
- Make sure to set the angle of the projectile before you use the "Move" action.  The projectile will turn towards the target, but you might want the projectile to be facing a certain direction. 
- Since Max Speed is not enforced on the physics object, you can accomplish this by changing Linear Decay on the Physics behavior
- Use the lifetime parameter to prevent missiles from chasing objects forever
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: HomingProjectile
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make a projectile object move towards a target object.

eventsFunctions.description: Lock projectile object to target object.  (This is required for "Move projectile towards target")
eventsFunctions.name: LockOnTarget

eventsFunctions.description: Move physics projectile towards the object that it has been locked to.  This action must be run every frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveTowardsTargetPhysics
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move physics projectile _PARAM1_ towards target _PARAM3_.  Rotate speed: _PARAM4_ Initial speed: _PARAM5_ Acceleration: _PARAM6_ Max Lifetime: _PARAM7_ Delete on collision: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Disable gravity on this object
Stop rotation forces
Rotate towards the target
Calculate the mass of the object
Set initial speed (making sure not to divide by 0)
Add physics force in the direction the projectile is pointing
Delete object if a lifetime has been set and reached
Delete if projectile touches target

parameters.longDescription: Projectile will be deleted after this value is reached.
parameters.name: MaxLifetime

parameters.description: Delete Projectile if it collides with Target:
parameters.name: DeleteOnCollision

eventsFunctions.description: Move projectile towards the object that it has been locked to.  This action must be run every frame.
eventsFunctions.name: MoveTowardsTarget
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move projectile _PARAM1_ towards target _PARAM2_.  Rotate speed: _PARAM3_ Initial speed: _PARAM4_ Acceleration: _PARAM5_ Max speed: _PARAM6_ Max Lifetime: _PARAM7_ Delete on collision: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Rotate towards the target
Push object in the direction it is facing (like a rocket propelling it)
Delete object if a lifetime has been set and reached
Delete if projectile touches target

parameters.longDescription: Projectile will be deleted after this value is reached.
parameters.name: MaxLifetime

parameters.description: Delete Projectile if it collides with Target:
parameters.name: DeleteOnCollision

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.

There are also actions to bounce at a *specific angle* - useful when you know the obstacle must generate a bounce that is always in a specific direction.

> ⚠️ This *won't work* with Physics engine or Platformer characters. This is working with objects that are moved using actions or behaviors using **the forces**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Bounce
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Bounce

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOff

events.comment:
To bounce the object realistically, we first separate it from the obstacle. The collision engine will do it by moving the object through the shortest "normal vector" of the edge that was collided.
We store the position of the object before being moved so that we know the angle of this "normal vector". Once we know it, we add a force in the direction of the normal vector, and we add the difference between the normal vector and the previous angle of movement.

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be calculated *to go toward the specified angle (the "normal angle")*. For example, if the object is arriving at this exact angle, it will bounce in the opposite direction.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Bounce off another object toward a specified angle
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffSpecificAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Bounce _PARAM0_ off _PARAM2_ assuming a normal angle of _PARAM3_

events.comment:
Check if there is a collision between the object and an obstacle and if so, do the bounce by stopping the object and adding a force so that it goes in the "reflected" direction, using the "normal" angle provided. 
This provides a realistic bounce.

parameters.description: The "normal" angle, in degrees, to bounce against
parameters.longDescription: This can be understood at the direction that the bounce must go toward.
parameters.name: NormalAngle

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be vertical, like if the object is *colliding a perfectly horizontal obstacle* (like the top/bottom of the screen in a pong game). For example, if the object is arriving with an angle of exactly 90 degrees, it will bounce in the opposite direction: -90 degrees.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffVertically

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be horizontal, like if the object is *colliding a perfectly vertical obstacle* (like paddles in a pong game). For example, if the object is arriving with an angle of exactly 0 degrees, it will bounce in the opposite direction: 180 degrees.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffHorizontally

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.


Example uses:
- Floating objects, such as powerups or coins
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns

Properties:
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.

Example uses:
- Floating pickups
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Horizontal distance

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SineMovement

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension can be useful for:
* Stick an accessory to a moving object,
* Animate a skeleton.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/) and Entropy (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClvkb12nOWFgWnQ56NF9Rcw)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will reduce opacity and size (if desired), the Z-value and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.

This extension can be used to:

- Make an object look faster, such as during a speed powerup.  
- Give a 3D-like feel to a character
- Implement unique time-based elements, like teleporting a character back to a previous location
- Simulate the movement of a caterpillar or slinky
- Recreate games like snake or tron

These object variables are provided to manage the shadow clones:

- ShadowCloneOrder: Shadow clone identifier, where 1 is the shadow clone closest to the primary object
- FramesBehindPrimary: The number of frames that the shadow clone is behind the primary object

Notes: 
- For shadow clones to work, this action must be run every frame.
- The ShadowCloneObject cannot be the PrimaryObject, but it can be a duplicate object. 
- For animations to work, the PrimaryObject and ShadowCloneObject must use the same animation numbers.

Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/2t4ANYgrrak) to see examples of how to use this extension.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShadowClones
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create and animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object.

eventsFunctions.description: Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will fade away (if desired), the Z-value of the shadow clones, and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object
eventsFunctions.name: AnimateShadowClones
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create and animate _PARAM3_ copies of _PARAM2_ that follow the position of _PARAM1_, with _PARAM4_ empty frames between shadow clones, and fading the opacity of shadow clones by _PARAM5_ per clone.  Shrink scale of shadow clones by _PARAM6_ per clone. Shadow clones will be created on _PARAM7_ layer with a Z-value of _PARAM8_.  Match X scale: _PARAM9_  Match Y scale: _PARAM10_  Match angle: _PARAM11_  Match animation: _PARAM12_  Match animation frame: _PARAM13_

Fix default value (min=1)
Calculate the max frames behind the primary that a shadow will exist
Create the right number of shadow clones (but only when there is position data)
Create shadow clones and link them to the primary object

Record new current position in index = 1

Calculate the max frames behind the primary that a shadow will exist
Create the right number of shadows
Create shadow clones at proper intervals and link them to the primary object

Set scale
Move shadow clones
Move shadow clones

Update FramesBehindPrimary if the FramesBetweenShadowClones has changed
Delete shadow clone if we have decreased number of shadow clones or changed distance between clones.  Reset counter variable.
Don't let counter go negative
Don't let counter go negative
Change opacity of shadow clone
Set scale
Clean-up unused history

Move position history to the next higher index, starting from the highest number (FramesBehind-1)
Move object history to one higher frame
Record new current position in index = 1
